com.mta.tehreer.graphics

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mta.tehreer.graphics.Renderer

  • public class Renderer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Renderer class represents a generic glyph renderer. It can be used to generate glyph paths, measure their bounding boxes and draw them on a Canvas object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Renderer.Cap
      Specifies the treatment for the beginning and ending of stroked lines and paths.
      static class  Renderer.Join
      Specifies the treatment where lines and curve segments join on a stroked path.
      static class  Renderer.Style
      Specifies if the primitive being drawn is filled, stroked, or both.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Renderer()
      Constructs a renderer object.

    • Method Detail

      • getRenderingStyle

        public Renderer.Style getRenderingStyle()
        Returns this renderer's style, used for controlling how glyphs should appear while drawing. The default value is Renderer.Style.FILL.
        Returns:
        The style setting of this renderer.

      • setRenderingStyle

        public void setRenderingStyle(Renderer.Style renderingStyle)
        Sets this renderer's style, used for controlling how glyphs should appear while drawing. The default value is Renderer.Style.FILL.
        Parameters:
        renderingStyle - The new style to set in the renderer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if renderingStyle is null.

      • getTypeface

        public Typeface getTypeface()
        Returns this renderer's typeface, used for drawing glyphs.
        Returns:
        The typeface of this renderer.

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(Typeface typeface)
        Sets this renderer's typeface, used for drawing glyphs.
        Parameters:
        typeface - The typeface to use for drawing glyphs.

      • getTextDirection

        public TextDirection getTextDirection()
        Returns this renderer's text direction, used to move pen while drawing glyphs. The default value is TextDirection.LEFT_TO_RIGHT.
        Returns:
        The text direction of this renderer.

      • setTextDirection

        public void setTextDirection(TextDirection textDirection)
        Sets this renderer's text direction, used to move pen while drawing glyphs. The default value is TextDirection.LEFT_TO_RIGHT.
        Parameters:
        textDirection - The new text direction to set.

      • getTextColor

        public int getTextColor()
        Returns this renderer's text color, used for filling glyphs. The default value is Color.BLACK.
        Returns:
        The text color of this renderer expressed as ARGB integer.

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(int textColor)
        Sets this renderer's text color, used for filling glyphs. The default value is Color.BLACK.
        Parameters:
        textColor - The 32-bit value of color expressed as ARGB.

      • getTextSize

        public float getTextSize()
        Returns this renderer's text size, applied on glyphs while drawing.
        Returns:
        The text size of this renderer in pixels.

      • setTextSize

        public void setTextSize(float textSize)
        Sets this renderer's text size, applied on glyphs while drawing.
        Parameters:
        textSize - The new text size in pixels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if textSize is negative.

      • getTextScaleX

        public float getTextScaleX()
        Returns this renderer's horizontal scale factor for glyphs. The default value is 1.0.
        Returns:
        The horizontal scale factor of this renderer for drawing/measuring glyphs.

      • setTextScaleX

        public void setTextScaleX(float textScaleX)
        Sets this renderer's horizontal scale factor for glyphs. The default value is 1.0. Values greater than 1.0 will stretch the glyphs wider. Values less than 1.0 will stretch the glyphs narrower.
        Parameters:
        textScaleX - The horizontal scale factor for drawing/measuring glyphs.

      • getTextScaleY

        public float getTextScaleY()
        Returns this renderer's vertical scale factor for glyphs. The default value is 1.0.
        Returns:
        The vertical scale factor of this renderer for drawing/measuring glyphs.

      • setTextScaleY

        public void setTextScaleY(float textScaleY)
        Sets this renderer's vertical scale factor for glyphs. The default value is 1.0. Values greater than 1.0 will stretch the glyphs wider. Values less than 1.0 will stretch the glyphs narrower.
        Parameters:
        textScaleY - The vertical scale factor for drawing/measuring glyphs.

      • getTextSkewX

        public float getTextSkewX()
        Returns this renderer's horizontal skew factor for glyphs. The default value is 0.
        Returns:
        The horizontal skew factor of this renderer for drawing glyphs.

      • setTextSkewX

        public void setTextSkewX(float textSkewX)
        Sets this renderer's horizontal skew factor for glyphs. The default value is 0.
        Parameters:
        textSkewX - The horizontal skew factor for drawing glyphs.

      • getStrokeCap

        public Renderer.Cap getStrokeCap()
        Returns this renderer's cap, controlling how the start and end of stroked lines and paths are treated. The default value is Renderer.Cap.BUTT.
        Returns:
        The stroke cap style of this renderer.

      • setStrokeCap

        public void setStrokeCap(Renderer.Cap strokeCap)
        Sets this renderer's cap, controlling how the start and end of stroked lines and paths are treated. The default value is Renderer.Cap.BUTT.
        Parameters:
        strokeCap - The new stroke cap style.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if strokeCap is null.

      • getStrokeJoin

        public Renderer.Join getStrokeJoin()
        Returns this renderer's stroke join type. The default value is Renderer.Join.ROUND.
        Returns:
        The stroke join type of this renderer.

      • setStrokeJoin

        public void setStrokeJoin(Renderer.Join strokeJoin)
        Sets this renderer's stroke join type. The default value is Renderer.Join.ROUND.
        Parameters:
        strokeJoin - The new stroke join type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if strokeJoin is null.

      • getStrokeMiter

        public float getStrokeMiter()
        Returns this renderer's stroke miter value. Used to control the behavior of miter joins when the joins angle is sharp.
        Returns:
        The miter limit of this renderer in pixels.

      • setStrokeMiter

        public void setStrokeMiter(float strokeMiter)
        Sets this renderer's stroke miter value. This is used to control the behavior of miter joins when the joins angle is sharp.
        Parameters:
        strokeMiter - The value of miter limit in pixels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if strokeMiter is less than one.

      • getShadowRadius

        public float getShadowRadius()
        Returns this renderer's shadow radius, used when drawing glyphs. The default value is zero.
        Returns:
        The shadow radius of this renderer in pixels.

      • setShadowRadius

        public void setShadowRadius(float shadowRadius)
        Sets this renderer's shadow radius. The default value is zero. The shadow is disabled if the radius is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        shadowRadius - The value of shadow radius in pixels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if shadowRadius is negative.

      • getShadowDx

        public float getShadowDx()

        Returns:
        The horizontal shadow offset of this renderer in pixels.

      • setShadowDx

        Parameters:
        shadowDx - The value of horizontal shadow offset in pixels.

      • generatePath

        public android.graphics.Path generatePath(int glyphId)
        Generates the path of the specified glyph.
        Parameters:
        glyphId - The id of glyph whose path is generated.
        Returns:
        The path of the glyph specified by glyphId.

      • generatePath

        public android.graphics.Path generatePath(int[] glyphIds,
                                          float[] xOffsets,
                                          float[] yOffsets,
                                          float[] advances,
                                          int fromIndex,
                                          int toIndex)
        Generates a cumulative path of the glyphs in specified range.
        Parameters:
        glyphIds - The array containing the glyph ids.
        xOffsets - The array containing the glyph x- offsets.
        yOffsets - The array containing the glyph y- offsets.
        advances - The array containing the glyph advances.
        fromIndex - The index of the first element (inclusive) to process.
        toIndex - The index of the last element (exclusive) to process.
        Returns:
        The cumulative path of the glyphs in specified range.

      • computeBoundingBox

        public android.graphics.RectF computeBoundingBox(int glyphId)
        Calculates the bounding box of specified glyph.
        Parameters:
        glyphId - The id of glyph whose bounding box is calculated.
        Returns:
        A rectangle that tightly encloses the path of the specified glyph.

      • computeBoundingBox

        public android.graphics.RectF computeBoundingBox(int[] glyphIds,
                                                 float[] xOffsets,
                                                 float[] yOffsets,
                                                 float[] advances)
        Calculates the bounding box of the glyphs.
        Parameters:
        glyphIds - The array containing the glyph ids.
        xOffsets - The array containing the glyph x- offsets.
        yOffsets - The array containing the glyph y- offsets.
        advances - The array containing the glyph advances.
        Returns:
        A rectangle that tightly encloses the paths of glyphs.

      • computeBoundingBox

        public android.graphics.RectF computeBoundingBox(int[] glyphIds,
                                                 float[] xOffsets,
                                                 float[] yOffsets,
                                                 float[] advances,
                                                 int fromIndex,
                                                 int toIndex)
        Calculates the bounding box of the glyphs in specified range.
        Parameters:
        glyphIds - The array containing the glyph ids.
        xOffsets - The array containing the glyph x- offsets.
        yOffsets - The array containing the glyph y- offsets.
        advances - The array containing the glyph advances.
        fromIndex - The index of the first element (inclusive) to process
        toIndex - The index of the last element (exclusive) to process
        Returns:
        A rectangle that tightly encloses the paths of glyphs in the specified range.

      • drawGlyphs

        public void drawGlyphs(android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
                       int[] glyphIds,
                       float[] xOffsets,
                       float[] yOffsets,
                       float[] advances,
                       int fromIndex,
                       int toIndex)
        Draws the glyphs in specified range onto the given canvas. The shadow will not be drawn if the canvas is hardware accelerated.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The canvas onto which to draw the glyphs.
        glyphIds - The array containing the glyph ids.
        xOffsets - The array containing the glyph x- offsets.
        yOffsets - The array containing the glyph y- offsets.
        advances - The array containing the glyph advances.
        fromIndex - The index of the first element (inclusive) to draw.
        toIndex - The index of the last element (exclusive) to draw.
